text: Curaçao Football Association (, or CVB) was a Curaçaosean football association. It was a member association of FIFA between 1932 and 1941, and 1946 to 1958. The CVB was responsible for the Curaçao national football team (1921–1958). Between 1941 and 1946, FIFA had decided to select Nederlands Antilliaanse Voetbal Bond (NAVB) as their member association. Unlike the CVB, The NAVB consisted of representatives from Aruba as well as Curaçao. The organisation was replaced with Netherlands Antillean Football Union (NAVU) in September 1958. == References == Category:Sports organizations established in 1921 Category:Organizations disestablished in 1958
title: Curaçao Football Association
